Frequently Asked Questions

Answers to common questions about HTMA and our approach

What is HTMA?

Hair Tissue Mineral Analysis (HTMA) is a lab test that measures the levels and ratios of minerals in your hair tissue. It helps assess metabolic function, toxicity, and more.

Why use hair instead of blood?

Hair provides a longer-term view of mineral status and toxic accumulation, whereas blood shows momentary levels.

Is HTMA safe and non-invasive?

Yes! It's a completely non-invasive test. Just cut a small hair sample from the scalp — no needles, no blood.

How long does it take to get results?

After your sample is submitted, results are typically ready in 7–10 business days.
